body:
What about just switching `Single` to `Local`?

If not, I don't mind the proposed change.

If we think ahead to when we are running on remote machines, then all these
options become Local.

I'm not crazy about the repetition in --process:inprocess but it's how I
always explain --process:single and the short form would take care of the
repetition.

Another possibility might be to do away with --process completely and just
have separate options  for each alternative. But I can't really think would
the options would be.

On Mon, Sep 28, 2015 at 3:17 PM, Rob Prouse notifications@github.com
wrote:

> What about just switching Single to Local?
> 
> If not, I don't mind the proposed change.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/847#issuecomment-143889490.
@oznetmaster it would mean to run in the same NUnit process, and not in a separate one; same as what 'single' currently means.

It's a good question. Always hard to know what people will understand most
readily.
On Sep 28, 2015 4:54 PM, "Victor Castillo Escoto" notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @oznetmaster https://github.com/oznetmaster it would mean to run in the
> same NUnit process, and not in a separate one; same as what 'single'
> currently means.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/847#issuecomment-143904753.
@CharliePoole, based on your comment on Local vs Remote, I am now in favor of InProcess.
I'll incorporate this in the branch I'm doing for issue #713

issue.title: Add command-line and settings elements to XML
issue.body:
This adds both a command-line element and a settings element to the XML. The command-line element shows what was entered and the settings element shows the settings pulled from that command line.

However, at this point, the engine defaults have not yet been added to the settings as discussed in issue #713. Only those settings specified on the command-line are included.

issue.title: Issue 847
issue.body:
Adds an InProcess alternative to --process and deprecates use of Single. Adds a --inprocess option as a shortcut to --process:InProcess. Removes unused (conditioned out) nunitlite tests.

Fixes #847
